questions.explanation:
7. Which theater did you go to?
(A) No, it wasn't. → Incorrect (unrelated to theater location)
(B) The one on Oak Ridge Road. → Correct (specifies the theater location)
(C) At six o'clock. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)

8. What's the last day to complete the survey?
(A) The customer service number. → Incorrect (unrelated to survey deadline)
(B) We have a new supplier. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Wednesday. → Correct (specifies the survey deadline)

9. When are you planning to move out of your apartment?
(A) Move it to the right, please. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'move' and is irrelevant)
(B) At the end of next month. → Correct (specifies the moving timeline)
(C) Here's the floor plan. → Incorrect (unrelated to timing)

10. When does the show begin?
(A) Yes, I showed her already. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'show' and is irrelevant)
(B) In the third row. → Incorrect (refers to seating, not time)
(C) It starts in an hour. → Correct (specifies the show’s start time)

11. Who will be leading the new team?
(A) Thomas has been selected. → Correct (identifies the team leader)
(B) The news release. → Incorrect (unrelated to leadership)
(C) A brand-new screen. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. Why was your flight delayed?
(A) Because there was bad weather. → Correct (explains the reason for the delay)
(B) We can reschedule the electrician's visit. → Incorrect (unrelated to flight delay)
(C) At the municipal airport. → Incorrect (refers to location, not reason)

13. Where are you planning to open your next store?
(A) Next January. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(B) Yes, in the floor plans. → Incorrect (vague and irrelevant)
(C) Near the city center. → Correct (specifies the store location)

14. Who designed the uniforms?
(A) You can sign in here. → Incorrect (unrelated to uniform design)
(B) Yes, we wear them for work. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the designer)
(C) A company in Chicago. → Correct (identifies the designer)

15. I recommend the vegetarian dinner special.
(A) OK, I'll have that. → Correct (accepts the dinner recommendation)
(B) Two bags of limes. → Incorrect (unrelated to the dinner special)
(C) Right by the elevator. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

16. How will we get this order filled in time?
(A) Would you like soup or salad? → Incorrect (unrelated to order fulfillment)
(B) Maria goes there, too. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) We'll have to work extra hours. → Correct (proposes a solution for the order)

17. Do you have the gate code, or should I look it up?
(A) It was recently painted. → Incorrect (unrelated to gate code)
(B) I have the number. → Correct (confirms possession of the gate code)
(C) A two-year lease. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. Should we visit the warehouse this week or next week?
(A) I'll be at corporate headquarters next week. → Correct (implies availability affecting the visit)
(B) Wow, that's a lot of space! → Incorrect (unrelated to visit timing)
(C) A visitor's pass. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. Don't you want to come to the employee luncheon?
(A) Yes, I'm looking forward to it. → Correct (confirms attendance at the luncheon)
(B) The largest conference room. → Incorrect (refers to location, not attendance)
(C) A variety of sandwiches. → Incorrect (describes food, not attendance)

20. Could you recommend a local hair salon?
(A) I'll need your receipt to process the refund. → Incorrect (unrelated to salon recommendation)
(B) Yes, the weather's supposed to be nice all week. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) There's a good stylist on Fourteenth Street. → Correct (recommends a salon)

21. I have some documents here for you to sign.
(A) It's at four tomorrow. → Incorrect (unrelated to signing documents)
(B) I like the design too. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) All right, let me take a look. → Correct (acknowledges the documents)

22. Are you planning to dine in, or would you like to take your food with you?
(A) Yes, it was delicious. → Incorrect (refers to past experience, not current plan)
(B) Just a little late. → Incorrect (unrelated to dining preference)
(C) I should probably get back to the office. → Correct (implies preference to take food)

23. Is this carpet the right size for the room?
(A) I'll turn it off when I'm finished. → Incorrect (unrelated to carpet size)
(B) I measured it three times. → Correct (implies confirmation of the carpet size)
(C) The warehouse is on River Street. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

24. You're aware that it's been six months since we've done inventory, aren't you?
(A) Can you introduce me to Victoria? → Incorrect (unrelated to inventory)
(B) That bottle goes on the top shelf. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Yes, we're doing it once a year now. → Correct (confirms inventory schedule)

25. I need to know who's attending the exposition.
(A) Try turning the valve to the left. → Incorrect (unrelated to attendance)
(B) Registrations aren't due until Friday. → Correct (addresses the attendance information)
(C) There are samples at booth 215. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

26. This computer is becoming quite slow.
(A) Please slow down. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'slow' and is irrelevant)
(B) A computer company. → Incorrect (unrelated to the issue)
(C) Here, you can use mine. → Correct (offers a solution to the slow computer)

27. Do you know if these towels are 100 percent cotton?
(A) These T-shirts should be folded for display. → Incorrect (unrelated to towel material)
(B) Production increased by 80 percent. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) There should be a label stitched on the edge. → Correct (directs to check for material information)

28. Shouldn't you send these manuscripts to your editor?
(A) Four hundred pages. → Incorrect (refers to length, not sending)
(B) I already e-mailed them to her. → Correct (confirms the manuscripts were sent)
(C) I should've brought my umbrella. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

29. I don't think Mr. Chen is back from his business trip yet.
(A) Yes, the waiting room is upstairs. → Incorrect (unrelated to Mr. Chen’s status)
(B) I thought check-out time was at noon. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I saw him just yesterday at the supermarket. → Correct (corrects the assumption about Mr. Chen)

30. Where is Barbara's office?
(A) Some office supplies, please. → Incorrect (unrelated to office location)
(B) Oh, the sales team moved downstairs. → Correct (implies Barbara’s office location with the sales team)
(C) A recent city election. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. The stage entrance to the theater was moved to Fourteenth Street, wasn't it?
(A) Oh, I really like that director's work. → Incorrect (unrelated to entrance location)
(B) Sure, I can hand out the programs. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I know they did some renovations recently. → Correct (supports the idea of a relocated entrance)
